attributes.action: encourage councils to provide more family homes by ending the Housing Subsidy System
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We ask the Government to encourage councils to build more family sized homes, by ending the Housing Subsidy System allowing councils the financial freedom and flexibility to run their own housing services and make them accountable to tenants.
To allow the South East to build more social housing for families, which meets their needs especially if they have disability issues.
To bring all stock up to the decent homes standard as soon as possible.
To allow re-investment of receipts from sales to provide more housing.
To restrict the re-sale of Right to Buy homes by including a clause to offer properties back to the council before the open market for a set period of time after purchase.
To restrict automatic succession of tenancies by non-resident family members.
